item.description:
The Nederlands Dans Theater 2 (the Dutch part) will be performing Jiří Kylián’s work (the Czech part). We can also go have a drink after the show – at the Foundation Lounge, unless I can think of a better place between now and then.

Jiří Kylián was born in Prague and studied at the Prague Conservatory, among other places. He became the artistic director (as well as coreographer) for Nederlands Dans Theater in 1978. I saw Boston Ballet perform a series of his pieces in February (Black & White @ the Wang) and it was wonderful. I was a bit surprised that Boston Ballet did them, because they are clearly not ballet. The pieces are modern dance – creative, funny, visually sparkling, modern dance. (Or, as one of the reviewers put it: “Black and White and contemporary all over.”)

In addition to Kylián’s work, the program also includes works by Paul Lightfoot and Sol Leon. I haven’t seen any of their work, but the reviews are good.
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the lobby. Please arrive at least 15 min before the performance

group.name: The Boston Euro Social Meetup Group
